title: NetHack brass
data:
| **NetHack brass as a patch**                                             |                                                                        |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Author                                                                   | Code by Youkan Patch from [Kernigh](/wiki/User:Kernigh "User:Kernigh") |
| Download                                                                 | [link](http://kernigh.pbwiki.com/f/brass-040923.diff)                  |
| [NetHack PatchDB](/wiki/NetHack_Patch_Database "NetHack Patch Database") | [279](http://nhpatchdb.alt.org/?279)                                   |

**NetHack brass** is a [variant](/wiki/Variant "Variant") based on [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), first released on September 23, 2004. It has an improved [skills](/wiki/Skills_\(NetHack_brass\) "Skills (NetHack brass)") system, the choice of a gift at [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"), and a new [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), including rivers and an icy cave. The latest version is NetHack brass 081221, which is entirely in Japanese.

NetHack brass has a [DOS](/wiki/DOS "DOS")/[Windows](/wiki/Windows "Windows") binary for immediate download, as well as a standalone patch for use with 3.4.3. For [Unix](/wiki/Unix "Unix") users, the best option is [compiling](/wiki/Compiling "Compiling") the 040923 sources after applying the [brass interface patch](/wiki/Brass_interface_patch "Brass interface patch"). There is an actively maintained repo for NetHack brass [on GitHub](https://github.com/youkan700/NetHack-brass) (which can be viewed via [alternate front-end](https://gothub.ducks.party/youkan700/NetHack-brass) if desired).

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 System changes](#System_changes)
- [2 New items](#New_items)
- [3 Changes to existing items](#Changes_to_existing_items)
- [4 Changes to existing monsters](#Changes_to_existing_monsters)
- [5 See also](#See_also)
- [6 External links](#External_links)

## System changes

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"More thorough detail on the system changes."*

- [Additional attribute caps by class.](/wiki/Maximum_attribute#NetHack_brass "Maximum attribute")
- [Altar conversion is more dangerous.](/wiki/Altar#Variants "Altar")
- New extended command: **#[bereave](/index.php?title=Bereave\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bereave (page does not exist)")** allows the player to attempt to steal from a monster's inventory.
- [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") files no longer include a gravestone for the late player.
- [Charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") modifiers added on selling quotes.
- The amount of any **damage** you are dealt, or deal with a weapon, is displayed along with hit messages.
- Status bar indicates current **[encumbrance](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance")**.
- [Erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") can destroy armor.
- The **[farlook](/wiki/Farlook "Farlook")** command now reveals a monster's weapons and armor.
- [Fooproofing](/wiki/Fooproof "Fooproof"), [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") will wear off with repeated use.
- Effectiveness of [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") reduced.
- New wizard mode command: #[rrllududab](/wiki/Rrllududab "Rrllududab")
- [Polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") only affects one object, thus eliminating [polypiling](/wiki/Polypile "Polypile").
- Only two points of **[protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection")** are guaranteed with donation.
- Natural HP **recovery** is drastically slowed, thus increasing the utility of [bandages](/wiki/Bandage "Bandage") and other healing items.
- Elemental **[resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")** reduce damage but do not nullify it.
- [Shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") may provide services as in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM").
- New **skills** system, consolidating redundant weapons groups and allowing as much skill growth as the player has patience to practice for. New extended command: #[skills](/wiki/Skills_\(NetHack_brass\) "Skills (NetHack brass)").
- Upon completion of [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"), you may choose from an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection"), [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding"), or [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") as your prize.

## New items

- [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials"), including some silver, mystic [weapons](/wiki/Weapons "Weapons"), and iron [sabers](/wiki/Saber "Saber")
- some golden, silver, bronze, mithril, and crystal [armors](/wiki/Armor "Armor")
- [maid dress](/wiki/Maid_dress "Maid dress"), [frilled apron](/wiki/Frilled_apron "Frilled apron"), [katyusha](/wiki/Katyusha "Katyusha")
- [nurse uniform](/wiki/Nurse_uniform "Nurse uniform"), [nurse cap](/wiki/Nurse_cap "Nurse cap")
- kitchen apron
- shield of firebreak, shield of isolation
- spellbook of torch, know enchantment
- wand of maintenance
- [bandages](/wiki/Bandage "Bandage") and [scissors](/wiki/Scissors "Scissors")
- some glasses
- sheaf of straw

These items are transplanted from [NetHack plus](/wiki/NetHack_plus "NetHack plus") or [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"):

- [revolvers](/index.php?title=Revolver\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Revolver (page does not exist)") and [muskets](/index.php?title=Musket\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Musket (page does not exist)")
- [robes](/wiki/Robe "Robe")
- magic [candle](/wiki/Candle "Candle")
- some [orbs](/wiki/Orb "Orb")
- some [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact")

## Changes to existing items

- Many pieces of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") have had their AC slightly increased.
- [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") now weighs 250 and provides 8 AC.
- [Gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") set your dexterity to that of your race/class maximum, similar to gauntlets of power; this will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") them when worn, even if you have reached that maximum.
- [Leather gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves") provide 0 AC.
- [Magic whistles](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") are charged magical tools.
- [Orange dragon scale mail](/wiki/Orange_dragon_scale_mail "Orange dragon scale mail") provides [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action").
- [Robes](/wiki/Robe_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Robe (SLASH'EM)") function as they do in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM").
- [Speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots") no longer set your [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") to very fast by default, instead providing a boost to speed that can stack with other sources.
- New [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") types: [bronze](/wiki/Bronze "Bronze") statues and [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") sculpture.
- [Unicorn horns](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") have a chance of disintegrating after use.
- [Unlocking tools](/wiki/Unlocking_tool "Unlocking tool") may break.
- The [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster")'s effects are now temporary.

## Changes to existing monsters

- A [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger") always imitates the player, including all inventory and attributes — though not, apparently, spells. Unhappily, its items will disappear when it is defeated by any means, so you cannot get two of the same [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"). You may still steal the doppelganger's items using the #bereave extended command, but artifacts gained in this way will revert to their base item. The stolen items will last until they are lost when put on the ground.
- [Floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye") can freeze you if you attack them with a [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm").
- [Straw golems](/wiki/Straw_golem "Straw golem") drop a number of sheaves of straw when they are killed.
- [Water elementals](/wiki/Water_elemental "Water elemental") have an [engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") attack that kills you by [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning") over several turns. They can also rust weapons like a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster").

## See also

- [Brass interface patch](/wiki/Brass_interface_patch "Brass interface patch")

## External links

- [NetHack brass](http://www.maroon.dti.ne.jp/youkan/nethack/index_e.html) including sources and DOS/Windows binary
- [Japanese page](http://www.maroon.dti.ne.jp/youkan/nethack/index.html) and [Google translation](http://translate.google.com/translate?prev=hp\&hl=en\&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.maroon.dti.ne.jp%2Fyoukan%2Fnethack%2Findex.html\&sl=ja\&tl=en) with latest source
- [Erebus page](https://web.archive.org/web/20230327165223/http://www.nicolaas.net/erebus/item.php?key=NetHackbrass) on NetHack brass
- [Codex Gamicus page for NetHack brass](https://gamicus.fandom.com/wiki/NetHack_brass)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
NetHack brass

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
NetHack brass as a patch
Author Code by Youkan
Patch from Kernigh
Download link
NetHack PatchDB 279

NetHack brass is a variant based on NetHack 3.4.3, first released on September 23, 2004. It has an improved skills system, the choice of a gift at Sokoban, and a new Gehennom, including rivers and an icy cave. The latest version is NetHack brass 081221, which is entirely in Japanese.

NetHack brass has a DOS/Windows binary for immediate download, as well as a standalone patch for use with 3.4.3. For Unix users, the best option is compiling the 040923 sources after applying the brass interface patch. There is an actively maintained repo for NetHack brass on GitHub (which can be viewed via alternate front-end if desired).

Contents

  • 1 System changes
  • 2 New items
  • 3 Changes to existing items
  • 4 Changes to existing monsters
  • 5 See also
  • 6 External links

System changes

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"More thorough detail on the system changes."

  • Additional attribute caps by class.
  • Altar conversion is more dangerous.
  • New extended command: #bereave allows the player to attempt to steal from a monster's inventory.
  • Bones files no longer include a gravestone for the late player.
  • Charisma modifiers added on selling quotes.
  • The amount of any damage you are dealt, or deal with a weapon, is displayed along with hit messages.
  • Status bar indicates current encumbrance.
  • Erosion can destroy armor.
  • The farlook command now reveals a monster's weapons and armor.
  • Fooproofing, magic resistance and reflection will wear off with repeated use.
  • Effectiveness of magic cancellation reduced.
  • New wizard mode command: #rrllududab
  • Polymorph only affects one object, thus eliminating polypiling.
  • Only two points of protection are guaranteed with donation.
  • Natural HP recovery is drastically slowed, thus increasing the utility of bandages and other healing items.
  • Elemental resistances reduce damage but do not nullify it.
  • Shopkeepers may provide services as in SLASH'EM.
  • New skills system, consolidating redundant weapons groups and allowing as much skill growth as the player has patience to practice for. New extended command: #skills.
  • Upon completion of Sokoban, you may choose from an amulet of reflection, bag of holding, or cloak of magic resistance as your prize.

New items

  • object materials, including some silver, mystic weapons, and iron sabers
  • some golden, silver, bronze, mithril, and crystal armors
  • maid dress, frilled apron, katyusha
  • nurse uniform, nurse cap
  • kitchen apron
  • shield of firebreak, shield of isolation
  • spellbook of torch, know enchantment
  • wand of maintenance
  • bandages and scissors
  • some glasses
  • sheaf of straw

These items are transplanted from NetHack plus or SLASH'EM:

  • revolvers and muskets
  • robes
  • magic candle
  • some orbs
  • some artifacts

Changes to existing items

  • Many pieces of body armor have had their AC slightly increased.
  • Dragon scale mail now weighs 250 and provides 8 AC.
  • Gauntlets of dexterity set your dexterity to that of your race/class maximum, similar to gauntlets of power; this will auto-identify them when worn, even if you have reached that maximum.
  • Leather gloves provide 0 AC.
  • Magic whistles are charged magical tools.
  • Orange dragon scale mail provides free action.
  • Robes function as they do in SLASH'EM.
  • Speed boots no longer set your speed to very fast by default, instead providing a boost to speed that can stack with other sources.
  • New statue types: bronze statues and ice sculpture.
  • Unicorn horns have a chance of disintegrating after use.
  • Unlocking tools may break.
  • The wand of speed monster's effects are now temporary.

Changes to existing monsters

  • A doppelganger always imitates the player, including all inventory and attributes — though not, apparently, spells. Unhappily, its items will disappear when it is defeated by any means, so you cannot get two of the same artifact. You may still steal the doppelganger's items using the #bereave extended command, but artifacts gained in this way will revert to their base item. The stolen items will last until they are lost when put on the ground.
  • Floating eyes can freeze you if you attack them with a polearm.
  • Straw golems drop a number of sheaves of straw when they are killed.
  • Water elementals have an engulfing attack that kills you by drowning over several turns. They can also rust weapons like a rust monster.

See also

  • Brass interface patch

External links

  • NetHack brass including sources and DOS/Windows binary
  • Japanese page and Google translation with latest source
  • Erebus page on NetHack brass
  • Codex Gamicus page for NetHack brass

Patch from [[User:Kernigh|Kernigh]] |download=http://kernigh.pbwiki.com/f/brass-040923.diff |bilious=279 }} '''NetHack brass''' is a [[variant]] based on [[NetHack 3.4.3]], first released on September 23, 2004. It has an improved [[Skills (NetHack brass)|skills]] system, the choice of a gift at [[Sokoban]], and a new [[Gehennom]], including rivers and an icy cave. The latest version is NetHack brass 081221, which is entirely in Japanese. NetHack brass has a [[DOS]]/[[Windows]] binary for immediate download, as well as a standalone patch for use with 3.4.3. For [[Unix]] users, the best option is [[compiling]] the 040923 sources after applying the [[brass interface patch]]. There is an actively maintained repo for NetHack brass [https://github.com/youkan700/NetHack-brass on GitHub] (which can be viewed via [https://gothub.ducks.party/youkan700/NetHack-brass alternate front-end] if desired). ==System changes== {{todo|More thorough detail on the system changes.}} * [[Maximum attribute#NetHack brass|Additional attribute caps by class.]] * [[Altar#Variants|Altar conversion is more dangerous.]] * New extended command: '''#[[bereave]]''' allows the player to attempt to steal from a monster's inventory. * [[Bones]] files no longer include a gravestone for the late player. * [[Charisma]] modifiers added on selling quotes. * The amount of any '''damage''' you are dealt, or deal with a weapon, is displayed along with hit messages. * Status bar indicates current '''[[encumbrance]]'''. * [[Erosion]] can destroy armor. * The '''[[farlook]]''' command now reveals a monster's weapons and armor. * [[Fooproof]]ing, [[magic resistance]] and [[reflection]] will wear off with repeated use. * Effectiveness of [[magic cancellation]] reduced. * New wizard mode command: #[[rrllududab]] * [[Polymorph]] only affects one object, thus eliminating [[polypile|polypiling]]. * Only two points of '''[[protection]]''' are guaranteed with donation. * Natural HP '''recovery''' is drastically slowed, thus increasing the utility of [[bandage]]s and other healing items. * Elemental '''[[resistance]]s''' reduce damage but do not nullify it. * [[Shopkeeper]]s may provide services as in [[SLASH'EM]]. * New '''skills''' system, consolidating redundant weapons groups and allowing as much skill growth as the player has patience to practice for. New extended command: #[[skills (NetHack brass)|skills]]. * Upon completion of [[Sokoban]], you may choose from an [[amulet of reflection]], [[bag of holding]], or [[cloak of magic resistance]] as your prize. ==New items== * [[object materials]], including some silver, mystic [[weapons]], and iron [[saber]]s *some golden, silver, bronze, mithril, and crystal [[armor]]s *[[maid dress]], [[frilled apron]], [[katyusha]] *[[nurse uniform]], [[nurse cap]] *kitchen apron *shield of firebreak, shield of isolation *spellbook of torch, know enchantment *wand of maintenance * [[bandage]]s and [[scissors]] * some glasses * sheaf of straw These items are transplanted from [[NetHack plus]] or [[SLASH'EM]]: * [[revolver]]s and [[musket]]s * [[robe]]s * magic [[candle]] * some [[orb]]s * some [[artifact]]s ==Changes to existing items== * Many pieces of [[body armor]] have had their AC slightly increased. * [[Dragon scale mail]] now weighs 250 and provides 8 AC. * [[Gauntlets of dexterity]] set your dexterity to that of your race/class maximum, similar to gauntlets of power; this will [[auto-identify]] them when worn, even if you have reached that maximum. * [[Leather gloves]] provide 0 AC. * [[Magic whistle]]s are charged magical tools. * [[Orange dragon scale mail]] provides [[free action]]. * [[Robe (SLASH'EM)|Robes]] function as they do in [[SLASH'EM]]. * [[Speed boots]] no longer set your [[speed]] to very fast by default, instead providing a boost to speed that can stack with other sources. * New [[statue]] types: [[bronze]] statues and [[ice]] sculpture. * [[Unicorn horn]]s have a chance of disintegrating after use. * [[Unlocking tool]]s may break. * The [[wand of speed monster]]'s effects are now temporary. ==Changes to existing monsters== *A [[doppelganger]] always imitates the player, including all inventory and attributes — though not, apparently, spells. Unhappily, its items will disappear when it is defeated by any means, so you cannot get two of the same [[artifact]]. You may still steal the doppelganger's items using the #bereave extended command, but artifacts gained in this way will revert to their base item. The stolen items will last until they are lost when put on the ground. *[[Floating eye]]s can freeze you if you attack them with a [[polearm]]. *[[Straw golem]]s drop a number of sheaves of straw when they are killed. *[[Water elemental]]s have an [[engulf]]ing attack that kills you by [[drowning]] over several turns. They can also rust weapons like a [[rust monster]]. ==See also== *[[Brass interface patch]] ==External links== * [http://www.maroon.dti.ne.jp/youkan/nethack/index_e.html NetHack brass] including sources and DOS/Windows binary * [http://www.maroon.dti.ne.jp/youkan/nethack/index.html Japanese page] and [http://translate.google.com/translate?prev=hp&hl=en&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.maroon.dti.ne.jp%2Fyoukan%2Fnethack%2Findex.html&sl=ja&tl=en Google translation] with latest source * [https://web.archive.org/web/20230327165223/http://www.nicolaas.net/erebus/item.php?key=NetHackbrass Erebus page] on NetHack brass * [https://gamicus.fandom.com/wiki/NetHack_brass Codex Gamicus page for NetHack brass] {{variant-343}} [[Category:Variants]] [[Category:NetHack brass]]
